column4: Who has used Zentyal for Samba/CIFS? I'm getting an error on a share I created when I go to access control. It's a huge massive long red error. Has anybody seen this by chance?
http://pastebin.com/3PDZp13F
How can I tell how far along my raid array sync is?
for software raid
Besides Webmin and Zentyal, what else is out there for web based server management?
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SysCP
it doesnt say anything about samba, raid control, etc...
are you looking for software to do the work for you?
I'm looking for web based software so I can manage this box from outside the network.
Im leaving behind a file server when I move out so I want to be able to forward the port and log in whenever I want. IT's for my parents.
I just want a quick way to see how the raid array is doing and tweak any CIFS shares I need to
why not set up ssh and a performance monitoring tool for the web piece?
I suppose that's an option too
how does my idea not make sense?
forward port, log in externally, see what I need to see, done.
the is issue is that there is no once size fits all for what you want to do

well I think zentyal does the job, but I'm getting some weird errors with it. I'm curious if rebooting it would help since I installed it, but I dont' want to interrupt my array that's cu rrently syncing.
I would wait until the array is in sync
I hear ya. I hate to tick it off. :P
it's hard to tho when I'm on the verge of falling asleep and zentyal says its got 49 minutes to complete :/
further 90 % of the wierd errors make perfect sense though we might not know what they are

well my thought process is with installing zentyal that attaches itself to contrlling things like samba, smb.conf, users and groups, etc, I wouldn't be surprised if a reboot is needed to sync things up, because I'm not seeing an option to add users in the zentyal panel and I can't seem to edit anything samba wise. Just a guess, though
